thread.title: Derek Brunson rips judges, says he ‘outclassed’ Anderson Silva at UFC 208
thread.title_full: Derek Brunson rips judges, says he ‘outclassed’ Anderson Silva at UFC 208

author: Marc Raimondi
title: Derek Brunson rips judges, says he ‘outclassed’ Anderson Silva at UFC 208
text:
Anderson Silva raises Derek Brunson’s hand after their UFC 208 fight. Esther Lin, MMA Fighting Derek Brunson was left feeling robbed in Brooklyn. The UFC middleweight wrote in a statement on Facebook that he does not understand how the judges at UFC 208 scored a victory for Anderson Silva in their fight Saturday night at Barclays Center. Brunson wrote that he felt like he “outclassed” Silva in the three-round fight that ended up going to “The Spider” via unanimous decision (30-27, 29-28, 29-28). 
‪Wow unreal I put my heart & soul out there on 3 weeks notice only to get it taken from me.I just outclassed the greatest of all time #UFC208‬ Posted by Derek Brunson on 11hb Februari 2017 Brunson (16-5) seemed to land the harder shots throughout the fight, particularly in the first and third rounds. A majority of media members scored the bout for Brunson, per MMADecisions.com . On Twitter, Brunson poked fun at the judges by posting a picture of blind singers Ray Charles and Stevie Wonder. — Derek Brunson (@DerekBrunson) February 12, 2017 Brunson, 33, has now lost two in a row officially despite what many saw as a winning performance Saturday night. The North Carolina native won five straight before that, including four first-round knockouts. Brunson lost to Robert Whittaker by first-round TKO in November.
